III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
R400.12311(1) Foster Parent/Agency Agreement.
• The agency was apprised that its documentation shall clearly and consistently
show that the agency signed the agreement.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R324.1234 Revaluation
• The agency was advised that related to addendum reports or summaries
reporting on the status of a foster parent's home/family situation it is advisable
to ensure these reports are signed and dated by the worker and supervisor.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans during this
licensing inspection period. This corrective action plan related to the agency's
2022 Interim Inspection where it received the following rule violations:
• R400.12310(2).
• R400.1310(3)(a)(i)(ii)()(xi).
The agency fulfilled the terms of the corrective action plan. It showed
documentations of its review of the corrective plan with staff during meetings and
discussion of it and the 3130 package during monthly supervisor/worker
supervisions as outlined in the corrective action plan.
It is noteworthy the agency received no rule violations this inspection. On another
note, the agency has been down a licensing worker since March of this year,
resulting in the licensing supervisor serving in a dual role. The agency anticipates
hiring a new licensing worker by August of this year.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The agency submitted a chief administrator’s report dated 7/5/2023.
The report was completed according to the form's requirements. No concerns
were observed.
Financial Overview
The agency provided an annual budget and a 9/30/2022 Independent financial
audit report which showed no areas of concern.
Staff and Youth Interviews
An entrance conference was held with the chief administrator and licensing
supervisor/worker. The licensing supervisor/ worker was also interviewed
separately in more detail. No concerns were reported.
This agency only license foster homes, there are no foster children or youths
connected, requiring interviews.
Description of Agency Walk Through
No concerns were observed.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
This a non-contractual agency. An Analyst review was not required.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION

Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
